name: CreateAudienceContact
description:
Create a new omni-channel contact for an audience.

Use this tool to add a new contact to a Mailchimp audience for omni-channel marketing.

parameters.name: audience_unique_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the audience in Mailchimp where the contact will be added. This ID is necessary to specify the target audience for the new contact.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the audience.

parameters.name: contact_details_json
parameters.description: JSON object containing contact details such as language, email, SMS info, merge fields, and tags for the new audience member.

status.description: Status of a contacts Marketing Consent

marketing_consent.description: A contact's current consent status for email marketing communications. See the [Audiences (BETA) documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/audiences-introduction) to learn about supported values.

status.description: The current consent status captured for a contact’s marketing communications.

marketing_consent.description: A contact's current consent status for SMS marketing communications. See the [Audiences (BETA) documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/audiences-introduction) to learn about supported values.

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

tags.description: An array of tag names to add to the contact. This operation is append-only; existing tags will be preserved, and only new tags from this array will be added.

parameters.name: merge_field_validation_mode
parameters.description: Choose 'ignore_required_checks' to skip validation on required merge fields, or 'strict' to enforce validation. Defaults to 'strict' if not set.

value_schema.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

parameters.name: data_processing_mode
parameters.description: Selects the data processing mode: 'historical' mode skips automations and webhooks, 'live' mode triggers them.

value_schema.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: merge_field_validation_mode
parameters.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

value_schema.description: Defines how merge field validation is handled. When set to `ignore_required_checks`, the API does not raise an error if required merge fields are missing from the request. When set to `strict`, the API enforces validation and returns an error if any required merge field is not provided. If this setting is omitted, `strict` is applied by default.

parameters.name: data_mode
parameters.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

value_schema.description: Indicates the data processing mode. In `historical` mode, contact data changes do not trigger automations or webhooks. In `live mode`, such changes do trigger them.

parameters.name: audience_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the audience.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the audience.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
